abstract: Warner Chilcott has agreed to buy Procter & Gamble’s prescription drug business, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Sunday.
snippet: Warner Chilcott has agreed to buy Procter & Gamble’s prescription drug business, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Sunday.
lead_paragraph: Updated with numbers | 9:45 p.m. Warner Chilcott has agreed to buy Procter & Gamble‘s prescription drug business for about $3 billion, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Sunday.

headline.main: Warner Chilcott to Buy Procter & Gamble Unit

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Zachery Kouwe

abstract: A deal to sell Procter & Gamble’s prescription drug business to Warner Chilcott for $3 billion may be announced as early as Monday.
snippet: A deal to sell Procter & Gamble’s prescription drug business to Warner Chilcott for $3 billion may be announced as early as Monday.
lead_paragraph: Warner Chilcott has agreed to buy Procter & Gamble’s prescription drug business for about $3 billion, people briefed on the matter said Sunday.

headline.main: Deal Said to Be Reached for Drug Unit
headline.print_headline: Deal Said to Be Reached for Drug Unit

abstract: Procter & Gamble said Monday that it agreed to sell its pharmaceuticals unit to Warner Chilcott for $3.1 billion in cash, as P&G seeks to focus on its consumer health and personal care businesses.
snippet: Procter & Gamble said Monday that it agreed to sell its pharmaceuticals unit to Warner Chilcott for $3.1 billion in cash, as P&G seeks to focus on its consumer health and personal care businesses.
lead_paragraph: Update | 10:22 a.m.  Procter & Gamble said on Monday that it agreed to sell its pharmaceuticals unit to Warner Chilcott for $3.1 billion in cash, as P&G sought to focus on its consumer health and personal care businesses.

headline.main: P&G Sells Drug Unit for $3.1 Billion

abstract: Warner Chilcott has agreed to buy Procter & Gamble’s prescription drug business, a move that could more than double its revenue.
snippet: Warner Chilcott has agreed to buy Procter & Gamble’s prescription drug business, a move that could more than double its revenue.
lead_paragraph: After struggling to gain a toehold in the pharmaceutical business, Procter & Gamble has finally decided to give up. The company announced on Monday that it would sell its global pharmaceutical business to the Irish drug maker Warner Chilcott for $3.1 billion, ending two decades of setbacks and missteps.

headline.main: With Sale, P.& G. Exits Global Drug Business
headline.print_headline: With Sale, P.& G. Exits Global Drug Business
